table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The Evapotranspiration Segments Package allows simulation of evapotranspiration with a user-defined relation between evapotranspiration rate and hydraulic head.

li.link: Banta, E.R., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey Modular Ground-Water Model - Documentation of Packages for Simulating Evapotranspiration with a Segmented Function (ETS1) and Drains with Return Flow (DRT1): U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-466, 127 p.

li.text: MODFLOW-2000
MODFLOW-2005
MODFLOW-LGR
MODFLOW-CFP
MODFLOW-NWT
MODFLOW-OWHM

para.text: Evapotranspiration is applied to the wrong cells because

li.text: The
UZF (not included in MODFLOW-2000)
package simulates evapotranspiration so the ETS package is not normally included in a model that includes the
UZF
package or at least not in the same locations.

para.text: Input to the ETS1 Package is read from the file that is type “ETS” in the
file. All single-valued variables are free format if the option “FREE” is specified in the Basic Package input file; otherwise, the variables have 10-character fields. Arrays are read by an
(Harbaugh and others, 2000), as indicated. Optional variables are shown in brackets.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional—“#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated as many times as desired.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional—“#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated as many times as desired.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NETSOP—is the evapotranspiration (ET) option code. ET variables (ET surface, maximum ET rate, and extinction depth) are specified in layer variables,

, with one value for each vertical column of cells in the model grid. Accordingly, ET is calculated for one cell in each vertical column. The option codes determine the cell within a column for which ET will be calculated.

li.text: If NETSOP = 1, ET is calculated only for cells in the top grid layer.
If NETSOP = 2, the cell for each vertical column is specified by the user in variable
If NETSOP = 3, ET to be applied to the uppermost active cell in each horizontal location.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IETSCB—is a flag and a unit number.

li.text: If IETSCB > 0, it is the unit number to which ETS1-Package cell-by-cell flow terms will be written when “SAVE BUDGET” or a non-zero value for
is specified in
(Harbaugh and others, 2000). IETSCB must be a unit number associated with a file listed with type “DATA(BINARY)” or “DATAGLO(BINARY)” in the name file.
If IETSCB ≤0, ETS1-Package cell-by-cell flow terms will not be written.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPETS—is the number of evapotranspiration-segments parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NETSEG—is the number of segments used to define the relation of evapotranspiration rate to hydraulic head in the interval where the evapotranspiration rate is variable.
Repeat Items 2 and 3 for each parameter to be defined (that is,
times). Items 2 and 3 are omitted if
If PARNAM is to be a time-varying parameter, the keyword
and a value for NUMINST must be entered.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM—is the name of a parameter to be defined. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP—is the type of parameter to be defined. For the ETS1 Package, the only allowed parameter type is “ETS,” which defines values of the maximum ET flux.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NCLU—is the number of clusters required to define a non-time-varying parameter or one instance of a time-varying parameter. Each repetition of Item 3b is a cluster (variables
). Usually only one cluster is needed to define an ETS non-time-varying parameter or instance of a time-varying parameter; however, more than one cluster may be listed.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: – is an optional keyword that designates a parameter as time varying. The keyword is case-insensitive; that is, it may be entered in any combination of upper- and lower-case letters. If
is present, it must be followed by a value for NUMINST. If
is absent, PARNAM is non-time-varying and NUMINST should not be present.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NUMINST – is the number of instances that are included in the definition of a time-varying parameter, where each instance is a series of NCLU clusters. If the keyword
is present, NUMINST must be present and must be at least 1. If the keyword
is absent, NUMINST should not be present.
repetitions of Item 3 (parts a and b) are read. After each repetition of Item 3a, NCLU repetitions of Item 3b are read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTNAM – is the name of an instance associated with parameter

specified in the corresponding Item 2. The name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. Names entered for INSTNAM must be unique for any given parameter, but names may be reused for instances associated with different parameters.
Each repetition of Item 3b record is called a parameter cluster. Repeat Item 3b
repetitions of Item 3b follow each repetition of Item 3a when

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: to be used to define the values determined by a parameter. The units of Parval times Mltarr must be (LT

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: ). The name “NONE” means there is no multiplier array, and the values will be set equal to

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: to be used to define the cells associated with a parameter. The name “ALL” means there is no zone array, and all cells are associated with the parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IZ—is up to 10 zone numbers (separated by spaces) that define the cells associated with a parameter. These values are not used if Zonarr is specified as “ALL.” Values can be positive or negative, but 0 is not allowed. The end of the line, a zero value, or a non-numeric entry terminates the list of values.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

li.text: If INETSS ≥0, a layer variable containing the ET surface (
) will be read from item 5 in the ETS1 input file.
If INETSS < 0, the ET surface from the preceding stress period will be reused.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: read flag. Its function depends on whether or not parameters are being used.

li.text: If no parameters are being used (
If INETSR ≥0, a layer variable containing the maximum ET rate (
) will be read from item 6 in the ETS1 input file.
If INETSR < 0, the maximum ET rate from the preceding stress period will be reused.
If parameters are being used (
If INETSR > 0, INETSR is the number of parameters used to define
in the current stress period. Item 7 defines the names of the parameters.
If INETSR < 0, ETS parameters from the preceding stress period are used.
INETSR = 0 is not allowed. That is, when parameters are used, at least one parameter must be specified for each stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

li.text: If INETSX ≥0, a layer variable containing the extinction depth (
) will be read from item 8 in the ETS1 input file.
If INETSX < 0, the extinction depth from the preceding stress period will be reused.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ) read flag. It is read if the ET option (
) is equal to two or if
is not equal to two, INIETS is ignored and IETS is not read.

li.text: If INIETS ≥0, a layer variable containing the layer indicators (
) will be read from item 9 in the ETS1 input file.
If INIETS < 0, layer indicators used during the preceding stress period will be reused.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSGDF—is the segment definition read flag. It is read only if

li.text: If INSGDF ≥0, two layer variables to define
and
for each of (
– 1) segment intersections are read from items 10 and 11, respectively, of the ETS1 input file.
If INSGDF < 0,
and
from the preceding stress period will be reused.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ETSS—is the elevation of the ET surface (L).
Either Item 6 or Item 7 may be read, but not both. If Item 7 is read, it is repeated

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ETSR—is the maximum ET flux (volumetric flow rate per unit area, LT

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Iname is read if Pname is a time-varying parameter. If IETSPF is specified for a non-time-varying parameter, Iname must be omitted.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Pname—is the name of a parameter that will be used to define the
variable in the current stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iname – is an instance name that is read only if Pname is a time-varying parameter. Multiple instances of the same time-varying parameter are not allowed in a stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IETSPF—is an optional format code for printing the
variable after it has been defined by parameters. The format codes are the same as those used in the
array reading utility module (Harbaugh and others, 2000).

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ETSX—is the ET extinction depth (L). This variable is read only if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IETS—is the layer indicator variable. For each horizontal location, IETS indicates the layer from which ET is removed. It is read only if the ET option (
) is equal to two and if
−1) repetitions of items 10 and 11 are read. If
> 2, items 10 and 11 are read for the uppermost segment intersection, followed by repetitions of items 10 and 11 for successively lower intersections.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PXDP—is a proportion of the extinction depth (dimensionless), measured downward from the ET surface, which, with
, defines the shape of the relation between the evapotranspiration rate and head. The value of PXDP must be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive. Repetitions of PXDP and

are read in sequence such that the first occurrence represents the bottom of the first segment, and subsequent repetitions represent the bottom of successively lower segments. Accordingly, PXDP values for later repetitions (representing lower segments) should be greater than PXDP values for earlier repetitions.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PETM—is a proportion of the maximum evapotranspiration rate (dimensionless) which, with
, defines the shape of the relation between the evapotranspiration rate and head. The value of PETM should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive. Repetitions of

and PETM are read in sequence such that the first occurrence represents the bottom of the first segment, and subsequent repetitions represent the bottoms of successively lower segments. Accordingly, PETM values for later repetitions (representing lower segments) generally would be less than PETM values for earlier repetitions.
